_configuration.artist.archive-confirmati: My portfolio may be included in the archive of the Berlin Art Prize will:
_configuration.artist.disclaimer:
I have read and accept the Berlin Art Prize Application Guidelines. I confirm that I have been working and living in Berlin for at least six months. I affirm that all works with which I am applying are my own and that they will be available for a studio visit by the jury.

If I am nominated for the Berlin Art Prize, I will deliver the works selected for the solo exhibition and pick them up when the exhibition is finished.

I also confirm that if I am nominated for the Berlin Art Prize, I will allow the jury and the organizing team of the Berlin Art Prize e.V. to choose which of the project spaces I will be assigned to for a solo exhibition.
_configuration.artist.disclaimer-confirm: I agree to the Berlin Art Prize Terms and Conditions.
_configuration.artist.residency-confirma: If I win the Berlin Art Prize, I would like to participate in the residency:
_configuration.jury.introduction:
Hello! Here you can view all applications. The artist's names have automatically been anonymized. The applications are first displayed in a list. You can always return to this during the jury process. If the preview is switched on by clicking the on / off button, an image from the application will be loaded into the background as a reminder of that application's content when you move your mouse over the application name.

The most important information for each application is available at a glance in the list view. Click on an application, and you will enter the artist's portfolio.  This was submitted by the artist either as a PDF or with individual works.

You can switch between the works in fullscreen mode, watch movies, play audio files, etc. With individually uploaded works you can learn more in the "Work Details" infobox. This can also be switched off if you prefer a view of only the work.  The "i" infobox, which can also be switched on and off, shows a general artist statement.

The app was designed so you can make notes about the application in the chat area. This can be switched on and off by clicking the speech bubble icon. The chat function allows you to make and save your thoughts, as well as share them with the other jurors. This exchange is essential in facilitating a decision – it should also be fun.

You can give an overall rating for the portfolio by clicking the blue "Rate" button: "Yes" means an absolute recommendation to the other jurors to see this artist's work, "No" means rejected/uninteresting, "Maybe" means that you find this artist's work interesting, but are unsure and therefore others should see this portfolio as well. Please always briefly justify your decision with a sentence or keywords. This reasoning is, like the chat notes, for internal use only. However, a short formulation of your reasons will help everyone involved to understand the sometimes difficult decision-making process that goes into choosing Berlin Art Prize nominees.

Enjoy!
_configuration.links.privacy.label: Privacy

application-form.application-is-by-group: This application is by a group.
application-form.has-no-influence-on-the: Has no influence on the jury’s decision.
edition.status--closed: This year's Berlin Art Prize has ended.
hints.dont-reveal-your-name: Important: Applicants should be careful not to reveal their names in their application texts. Likewise, the names of exhibition venues, curators, or other institutions and persons related to the promotion of your work must not appear in your application texts. For more information, see the Berlin Art Prize Terms and Conditions.
hints.other-edition-will-be-deactivated: (!) Edition <q>{{name}}</q> is currently active and will be deactivated when you activate this edition!
hints.test-your-application: Please check the order of your images and videos. These should be in the order you would like to be presented to the jury. By clicking the button above, you can see the jury's view of your application.
